RT @Public_Citizen .@PramilaJayapal: We can’t talk about this pandemic or health care in this country without talking about institutionalized racism. Black Americans are nearly 5x more likely to be hospitalized as white Americans and they’re twice as likely to die from COVID-19. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1308932381332705283/pu/img/Mb5wVnaVDcJJw0TS.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1308932381332705283/pu/vid/480x270/_UehHzY1FmOmb3UM.mp4?tag=10

RT @Public_Citizen .@RevDrBarber: There was a lot of death going on before COVID. A quarter-million people were dying a year from poverty.

We have to deal with necropolitics.

Racism, classism, and denying health care has always had what I call the DM on the DL - Death Measurement on the Down-Low. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1308935717167529991/pu/img/-Vxpguxahi910ouS.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1308935717167529991/pu/vid/476x270/sk9kAutLNYuZRW1Q.mp4?tag=10

“In a three mile radius — Cambridge, home to MIT and Harvard, to Roxbury, the blackest part of my district, life expectancy drops by 30 years… These health care injustices are not naturally occurring. They are legislated.” –@AyannaPressley http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1308942548618997761/img/JueH3Xn2P388qErI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1308942548618997761/vid/480x270/rqirO9uhR0mB8BKy.mp4?tag=13

"How differently America would have reacted to the pandemic if we already had Medicare for All. Every other industrialized country realized a long time ago that health care can’t be tied to employment, that it needs to be guaranteed to everyone.” –@PramilaJayapal http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1308931715264520192/img/nymglZ7ZMW6FESdJ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1308931715264520192/vid/480x270/Z6_BOfuUKTe9l0QT.mp4?tag=13

"In a for-profit, employer-based [health care] system, people get left in the cold and out in the dark." –@FlyingWithSara http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1308928860268892162/img/5yjm6lKzZwbg7to0.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1308928860268892162/vid/480x270/OP714zKviojtut4e.mp4?tag=13

RT @Public_Citizen .@BernieSanders: Of all the major industrialized countries in the world, there is one country that does not guarantee health care to all people as a human right. What we must do now: 

➡️Ensure Biden wins in a landslide

➡️Hold Congressional hearings on how local officials plan to handle Election Day processes

➡️State legislatures must allow votes to be counted as they come in

➡️Help Americans understand we may not know results on Nov 3

Never in this country's history have we failed to have a peaceful transition of power from one president to the next. We must do all we can to make sure Trump isn't the first. In this election the future of American democracy is at stake. We must not lose.

Fundamental to democracy is the peaceful transition of power; without that, there is Belarus. Any suggestion that a president might not respect this Constitutional guarantee is both unthinkable and unacceptable.

.@JoeBiden and I are keeping the police officers who were shot in Louisville in our hearts, wishing them a swift and speedy recovery. Violence is not the answer and we must find a way to express our grief, anger, and demands in ways that reflect the world we wish to see. https://twitter.com/JoeBiden/status/1308965630104616961 QT @JoeBiden Even amidst the profound grief & anger today's decision generated, violence is never & can never be the answer. Those who engage in it must be held accountable. Jill & I are keeping the officers shot tonight in Louisville in our prayers. We wish them both a swift & full recovery.

Tonight, I’m thinking of Breonna Taylor’s family who is still grieving the loss of a daughter and sister. 

We must never stop speaking Breonna’s name as we work to reform our justice system, including overhauling no-knock warrants.

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was an icon who used every ounce of life she was bestowed to urge our nation down a path toward equal justice. 

As she lies in repose today, tell me below what her life and legacy means to you.

In high school, I found out my best friend was being molested by her father. One of the reasons I wanted to be a prosecutor was to protect people like her. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eim3XzRXsAIlCGc.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1308777779786395650/vid/480x270/2sWtbRxO5NLMj_Pq.mp4?tag=13

RT @SenSchumer Justice Ginsburg was a champion for justice and a trailblazer for women

And like @SenSanders and me, she was a graduate of Brooklyn's James Madison H.S.

As fellow graduates, we stood together to pay our respects to her today at the Supreme Court

We are fighting for her legacy http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EinpbcjXgAIGvP-.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EinpcxzXgAIBana.jpg

The American people are sick and tired of brutal police killings without consequences. It’s time to fundamentally reform our racist and broken criminal justice system, end qualified immunity and hold police officers accountable. #BreonnaTaylor

Just one vote. I can only imagine that in this moral moment, Ruth Bader Ginsburg would want us to stand up and fight for the ideals of equality and justice to which she devoted her life.

That's what we must do—fight harder than we ever have before. Our democracy depends on it.

It didn't have to be this way. The staggering loss of life is a national tragedy. Let us mourn for all of our fellow Americans that we've lost to this virus. https://www.nj.com/news/2020/09/us-hits-unfathomable-milestone-200000-dead-from-the-coronavirus.html

That’s why the House passed the George Floyd #JusticeInPolicing Act this summer. We owe it to Breonna Taylor, George Floyd, Philando Castile and so many others to finally bring an end to police brutality.

Breonna Taylor should be alive today. She should be living and laughing and loving. Instead, her family is left continuing the search for justice. Today's charging decision holds no one accountable for her death.

President Trump has trampled on American democracy. 
 
But House Democrats will protect and strengthen it for generations to come.
 
The #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act will prevent presidential abuses, restore our system of checks & balances and protect our elections. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EinzaUrXYAIIVo6.jpg
Today, @HouseDemocrats are taking action to preserve American democracy for future generations as we introduce the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1vOxwkaDaWvxB

The threat from foreign actors of disinformation & interference leading up to & in the aftermath of our elections remains real & we have more adversaries now involved. 

But our federal agencies are far more prepared than in 2016.

An important week in #Florida’s fight against #COVID19

It was at this point after Memorial Day that we saw a surge in new cases 

So far only a slight uptick in positivity rate & ER visits for #Covid like illness are stable

New study adds to the growing mountain of proof that China’s industrial policy was not a win-win proposition.

For every 100 factories opened in China, 12.5 U.S. factories in the same industry disappeared. 

This cannot continue. https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3564494

We can’t lose focus on how hard it still is for many people. 

People are still being laid off. 

Many hotels & restaurants are only hiring part time. 

Who can make it on a paycheck of 2 days of work? 

I will keep trying to at least pass another round of PPP help. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1308780277267861505/pu/img/LR6sIs0UpxTgUUeO.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1308780277267861505/pu/vid/320x470/zmXLqQOtSiAjzMs2.mp4?tag=10
